qas.question: What cities influenced how department stores in Germany operated?
What department store was taken over by Nicolas Berggruen in 2010?
What major department store operates in Berlin?
What store is a part of the Metro AG?
What cities influenced how department stores in Austria operated?
What department store was taken over by Nicolas Berggruen in 2011?
What department store wasn't taken over by Nicolas Berggruen in 2010?
What major department store no longer operates in Berlin?
What store isn't a part of the Metro AG?

context: The design and function of department stores in Germany followed the lead of <a0_0><b4_0>London, Paris and New York<b4_0/>.<a0_0/> Germany used to have a number of department stores; nowadays only a few of them remain. Next to some smaller, independent department stores these are <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Karstadt<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> (in 2010 taken over by Nicolas Berggruen, also operating the <a2_0><b7_0>KaDeWe<b7_0/><a2_0/> in Berlin, the Alsterhaus in Hamburg and the Oberpollinger in Munich), <a3_0><b8_0>GALERIA Kaufhof<b8_0/><a3_0/> (part of the Metro AG). Others like Hertie, Wertheim and Horten AG were taken over by others and either fully integrated or later closed.
